Noun: the rate of flow of energy or particles across a given surface
a substance added to molten metals to bond with impurities that can then be readily removed
excessive discharge of liquid from a cavity or organ (as in watery diarrhe)
a state of uncertainty about what should be done (usually following some important even)
the lines of force surrounding a permanent magnet or a moving charged particle
Verb: move or progress freely as if in a stream
become liquid or fluid when heated
